snippet: For investigators preparing a recommendation that the government sue, a main line of inquiry has been whether Google has manipulated its search results to favor its products.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission is preparing to recommend that the federal government sue Google, raising the ante in its antitrust confrontation with the search giant; case centers around whether Google manipulates search results to favor its own products, making it harder for competitors and their products to appear prominently on results pages.

byline.contributor: Claire Cain Miller and Edward Wyatt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: For investigators preparing a recommendation that the government sue, a main line of inquiry has been whether Google has manipulated its search results to favor its products.

headline.seo: F.T.C. Staff Prepares Antitrust Case Against Google Over Search
headline.main: Drafting Antitrust Case, F.T.C. Raises Pressure on Google
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Said To Prepare For Lawsuit Vs. Google
